results.title: Benji the hunted
results.creator_credit: Joe Camp, Ben Vaughn and Embark
results.brief_description: Benji faces his toughest challenge as he braves the elements after being lost at sea and washed ashore in North America. Benji is responsible for his own survival as well as the litter of orphaned cougar cubs relying on him to guide them to safety. Created and directed by Joe Camp.

results.title: Berserk 6: God's Hand Ep. 22-25
results.creator_credit: Toshiaki Okuno, Toshio Nakatani, Naohito Takahashi and OLM
results.brief_description: Episodes 22-25 (final) of “Berserk”, Japanese anime series set in the Middle Ages. Gatsu, a dark knight and skilled swordsman, bears a mark of mysterious origins and is on a quest to find the being who branded him. Adapted from the comic book by Kentaro Miura, “Young animal”, this decidedly sinister series is filled with kinetic displays of magic, depicting violent and gory encounters whilst conjuring a mood evocative of gothic horror. Ep. 22 Griffith is being tortured but his Hawks have not given up on him. Ep. 23 The army pursues the fleeing Hawks; Griffith is very frail; Gatsu realises the depths of his feelings for Caska. Ep. 24 As Griffith hovers between life and death, the terrible truth behind his destiny is revealed. Ep. 25 Will Gatsu and Caska become sacrificial beings, as predicted? In an attempt to save her, Gatsu faces an array of marauding beasts. Final episode of “Berserk”.

results.title: Berserk 4: Devil's advocate Ep. 14-17
results.creator_credit: Toshiaki Okuno, Toshio Nakatani, Naohito Takahashi and OLM
results.brief_description: Episodes 14-17 of “Berserk”, Japanese anime series set in the Middle Ages. Gatsu, a dark knight and skilled swordsman, bears a mark of mysterious origins and is on a quest to find the being who branded him. Adapted from the comic book by Kentaro Miura, “Young animal”, this decidedly sinister series is filled with kinetic displays of magic, depicting violent and gory encounters whilst conjuring a mood evocative of gothic horror. Ep. 14 Koska is trapped and Gatsu must face a brutal encounter with 100 soldiers. Ep. 15 Koksa has conflicted emotions about Gatsu and her devotion to Griffith. Ep. 16 With the aim of capturing Doldery, the knights face the strongest of Chuder’s army. Ep. 17 In the final battle between Midland and Chuder, the outcome means more than simply victory or defeat.

results.title: Berserk 3: White Hawk Ep. 10-13
results.creator_credit: Toshiaki Okuno, Toshio Nakatani, Naohito Takahashi and OLM
results.brief_description: Episodes 10-13 of “Berserk”, Japanese anime series set in the Middle Ages. Gatsu, a dark knight and skilled swordsman, bears a mark of mysterious origins and is on a quest to find the being who branded him. Adapted from the comic book by Kentaro Miura, “Young animal”, this decidedly sinister series is filled with kinetic displays of magic, depicting violent and gory encounters whilst conjuring a mood evocative of gothic horror. Ep. 10 After completing a brutal assignment, Gatsu is wounded, and haunted by his actions. Ep. 11 When Griffith heads off to war, his Hawks are involved in a bloody skirmish on the front line. Ep. 12 Stranded in a cave with Gatsu, Caska relives her brutal past. Ep. 13 Wounded and trapped in enemy territory, Caska and Gatsu struggle to rejoin their battalion.

results.title: Bereavement in later life
results.creator_credit: Mike Crisp, Jo Marcus and A Webber
results.brief_description: Six retired people discuss their individual and fairly recent experiences of bereavement. Highlights the unique circumstances facing older people, including changes in lifestyle, socio-economic positions, roles, expectations and the complications that can arise. The overall aim is to show death and bereavement from an older person’s viewpoint, based on their life experiences.

results.title: Benoit [Sub-titled in English]
results.creator_credit: Beverly Shaffer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Benoit is an astonishingly accomplished eleven year old Quebecois from Joliette. He persues such diverse activities as weight lifting and playing the violin. Member of the Orchestre symphonique des jeunes de Joliette, he still finds time to indulge in a busy life with peers and elders alike. This film moves at Benoit’s pace, which is mostly a fast one. (Awards: Yorkton; Lausanne).

results.title: Benjamin Smoke
results.creator_credit: Jem Cohen, Peter Sillen, C-Hundred Film Corporation, Cowboy Booking International, Gravity Hill Films and Pumpernickel
results.brief_description: This American documentary focuses on songwriter, composer and singer, Benjamin (born Robert Dickerson) over the course of ten years as he negotiates the music scene hoping to make a name for himself and maintain the status quo of his life. Benjamin is an underground musician, speed freak, occasional drag queen and HIV+ homosexual man playing punk, fronting the queer-core band Opal Foxx Quartet before forming the blues-oriented band Smoke. Benjamin is from Cabbagetown, Atlanta, home of the go-cart and a mill town where, in Benjamin’s youth, people were poor and drugs and hustlers were in abundance. Extensive interviews with Benjamin are revelatory and deeply personal as he discusses his drug intake, creative urges, sex, gay politics, being HIV+, death and his life’s ambitions. Footage of Benjamin performing live and in the studio shows him to be a talented artist, who sings in a style similar to Tom Waits. This compassionate portrait is quite riveting and fairly down-beat but is also an inspiring chronicle of the human spirit. Jem Cohen and Peter Sillen flesh out the context of Benjamin’s upbringing by examining the social strata of Cabbagetown, an under-ground haven and seedy white-trash neighbourhood before being yuppified in the 1990s. Features a guest appearance by Patti Smith, an artist who inspired Benjamin, and in the bonus footage, a live performance from Chan Marshall, aka Cat Power.

results.title: Behind the veil: nuns. Pt. 2.
results.creator_credit: Margaret Wescott, Kathleen Shannon, Signe Johansson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Part 2 of an in depth look at the history and influence of the largest all female, communal organisation in the world. The film spans the twenty centuries since Jesus’ birth as well as the pre-Christian climates from which Christianity has evolved. This film reviews the few exceptional periods in history when women wielded power in religious life - in pre-Christian Celtic religions and during the era of the great abbesses of the Middle Ages. Their paintings, inventions, tapestries, books and manuscripts are eloquent testimony to their achievements. However, with the revival of misogynistic theories that females were unsuitable to perform priestly functions and not worth educating, these achievements were soon dismissed. Women were excluded from universities for the next eight centuries. Today, women are openly questioning the Church’s male hierarchy and seeking some measure of influence in Church decisions. In Part 2 some of today’s activist nuns speak about their convictions and the need to redefine the Church to combine spirituality with global politics.

results.title: Belch
results.creator_credit: Lesley Pinder and Victorian College of the Arts
results.brief_description: Buried in the outer suburbs of Melbourne it appears many subcultures are alive and well. Just ask Bill Hudson (Ian Thomas), the pride of the town, who for the past three years won the coveted Burping Competition. Although great burps run in the family the daughter Jo (Alex Schepisi) struggles to be accepted as she is unable to burp. Made to feel an outcast she goes to great lengths to change her predicament and prove herself as worthy. Other cast members include: Marie-Theresa Byrne, Michael Gwynne, Stuart Baker, Morgan Evans and Renato Bartolomei.
